name: Cafe Owner
text: Phew, what a busy hour.
All of my customers took what's left of the stock.
Hmm, but I should take a break first. It's time to do my training.
Who's there?

name: Kiernan
text: You got sharp senses there.

name: narrator
text: A figure appeared out of a whirlwind of shadows.

name: Cafe Owner
text: Hmph, I may be retired from adventuring, but that doesn't mean I'll let my skills get rusty.

name: Kiernan
text: All I ask is one loaf of bread, and we can settle this peacefully.

name: Cafe Owner
text: You got some guts, even thinking of the possibility I'll let some rat steal from my place.

name: Kiernan
text: ...It seems we have to do this the hard way.
(Let's see. I can steal the bread first, then run away. But, it does pose a risk of the owner chasing after my tail.)
(Or I could try to beat him in a fight, then safely take the bread with me. Of course, losing is very likely, seeing that he used to fight and adventure in the wild.)
(Calmly think about this, Kiernan.)

choices.text: Fight him first, then take the bread

name: narrator
text: Kiernan's figure blended into the shadows, swiftly taking the loaf of bread with him.

name: narrator
text: However...

name: narrator
text: *PUNCH*

name: Kiernan
text: Guh!

name: Cafe Owner
text: Don't take me for a fool. Using dark magic to hide yourself in the shadows--a predictable tactic.

name: narrator
text: *FLARE*

name: Cafe Owner
text: Wh--

name: narrator
text: The cafe owner quickly dodged the attack.

name: Cafe Owner
text: Fire magic too--

name: Cafe Owner
text: Oh? You're approaching me?

name: narrator
text: Fire covered Kiernan's fists as he threw in a punch.

name: Cafe Owner
text: Too slow.

name: narrator
text: *PUNCH*

name: Kiernan
text: Guh!

name: Cafe Owner
text: I've had better rugrats steal from this place than you. Hmm?

name: narrator
text: *WHAM*

name: narrator
text: A whip of darkness lashed out for his legs.

name: Cafe Owner
text: Tch, first it's fire magic, then it's dark magic too...?
Wait, the bread--

name: Kiernan
text: (Run!)

name: Cafe Owner
text: Get back here!

name: Kiernan
text: So long!
Hah...hah...I think I finally managed to lose him...
Life had never been fair to me. Born in a poverty-stricken place with no one to support me, I guess you could say I grew up pretty quickly.
From a young age, I had to steal and pickpocket from others in order to survive.
Even though the people running the town say that they will help the people of the slums, they never do. It's all just lip service, serving to make themselves look better.
And it wasn't just them either. You couldn't even trust the people in the slums. If you did, they would stab you in the back the moment things start to turn sour.
So, I lived my whole life wandering around the town, the back alleys, searching and scavenging for my next meal.
Can you even call it living, though? Living this sorry excuse for a life?
There has to be some sort of greater purpose I can live. I just have to find it.
Well, at least I got a decent haul--

name: narrator
text: *CRACK*

name: Kiernan
text: Huh? What was that?
Nothing seems to be out of place--
...Who's there?

name: Thug 1
text: Heh. How impressive. I'm surprised you managed to find us out.

name: Kiernan
text: You severely underestimated me. An ambush won't be enough to take me down, especially after making a blunder like exposing yourself so easily.

name: Thug 1
text: Don't get me wrong. Whatever that sound was, it didn't come from us.

name: Kiernan
text: It doesn't matter. You don't know who you're dealing with.

name: Thug 2
text: Is that a threat?

name: Thug 1
text: Enough talk. Get him!

name: narrator
text: Turn-based Battle

name: Thug 2
text: Damnit, run!

name: Thug 1
text: You don't have to tell me twice!

name: Kiernan
text: What nuisances. (Anyway, I should eat my well-deserved meal.)

name: narrator
text: *CRACK*

name: Kiernan
text: Huh? Again? Just what is that sound?
Ah, there you are.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Huh?
I was looking all over for you.

name: Kiernan
text: What are you talking about? Who are you? (...Is he one of the guys I stole from before?)
Hmm, I see. You want to take revenge on me for stealing from you. (I'm confident in my abilities. Besides, he's only an old man. I can take him on.)
Settle down. I am not here to fight nor harm you.

name: Kiernan
text: Is that so? (I can't let my guard down. He's clearly here to take advantage of me.)
(But I can also use this situation to my advantage too--)
(Make a choice before it's too late!)
An old tactic you frequently use. Honestly, it's becoming quite tiring.

name: Kiernan
text: Huh?! (It's like something is grabbing me!)
How many times are you going to run away?

name: Kiernan
text: Ugh...
Now then, I suppose introductions are in order.

name: Kiernan
text: (Even an old man like him can have something valuable on him. I can basically smell it!)
Don't even think about it. I can tell what you're thinking.
But, don't worry. I'll forgive this transgression if you promise to give me a second to explain everything.

name: Kiernan
text: (I-I almost got punished for committing thought crimes.)
Now then, I suppose introductions are in order.

name: Kiernan
text: (...I don't know. Somehow, this old man...I don't think I can get away from messing with him.)
(Maybe, I'll play it safe and try to get on his good side.)
Can we...talk this out?
Ah, you're unusually cooperative right now. Strange, how strange.

name: Kiernan
text: Huh?
But, no matter. I suppose some introductions and explainations are in order.
I am Ulric, a humble teacher who teaches the art of magic.

name: Kiernan
text: I see...what does a magic teacher want to do with me?

name: Ulric
text: Do not play dumb with me. I already know of your magic ability.
A highly talented mage with affinities for fire and darkness. For someone who was self-taught, you are quite a capable magic user.

name: Kiernan
text: You must be confusing me with someone else, old man. I'm just an ordinary person with absolutely no magic prowess.

name: Ulric
text: A pointless lie. Any mage can see the mana oozing out from you.

name: Kiernan
text: ...*sigh* I guess, there wasn't any point in hiding it.

name: Ulric
text: A useless endeavor.

name: Kiernan
text: You--
(But now that I think about it, this old man is also a mage.)
(But if that's the case, why can't I sense any mana coming off of him?)

name: Ulric
text: Now, onto the most important question I have.
You heard a loud crack sometime ago, correct?

name: Kiernan
text: Huh? (I did, but what does it have to do with this?)

name: Ulric
text: Look at the sky.

name: narrator
text: It was a small sliver of a crack, but it was there. A small crack in the sky.

name: Kiernan
text: T-The sky...! That definitely wasn't there before...!
What's going on?!

name: Ulric
text: Kiernan, you have to listen to me.

name: Kiernan
text: What? How do you know my name?

name: Ulric
text: Kiernan.
The world is ending.

name: Ulric
text: This world is past its prime and is collapsing as we speak. After centuries of erosion and weathering, I'm afraid that the world isn't able to hold on much longer.

name: Kiernan
text: ...What? What are you talking about...?!

name: Ulric
text: If humanity has to stop the collapse, we will need to collect the six Origin Crystals, forged by the Originator, scattered across the world.
With the crystals in hand, we will be able to restore and rejuvenate the world, back to its prime.

name: Kiernan
text: Stop! Hold it! Just let me have something to say!
You go off, spouting things like the world is gonna end and whatever crystals, but where's your proof?

name: Ulric
text: Isn't that the proof you need?

name: narrator
text: He points at the crack in the sky.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Yes, but it could be just some...unique weather phenomenon...

name: Ulric
text: Do you really believe that to be the case?

name: Kiernan
text: I can't just believe everything you've said.
(I know something is up. This whole thing reeks of suspicion)

name: Ulric
text: How about this? I will show you one of the crystals. A genuine creation made by the Originator.

name: Kiernan
text: One of the crystals?

name: Ulric
text: Yes. The crystals are what make up the world, both physical and incorporeal.
The Originator created the Origin Crystals when he created the world and its first humans.
However, the humans lacked reason, thought, and morality. Thus, the Originator created the Light and Dark Crystals.
The Light Crystal is the source of the righteousness and goodness of man, while the Dark Crystal is the source of the evil and wickedness of man.
Without the Light Crystal, man would cast upon their vile desires unto others and the world. However, without the Dark Crystal, man would be content with stagnancy and wouldn't strive for change.
The two create a balance upon which our world is built. They are called the Moral Crystals for they are the foundation of man's nature.
However, the humans did not have a foothold to place their feet upon and drifted into the emptiness of space.
So, the Originator forged the Earth Crystal to offer us the earth and land on which we place our feet on.
The humans were grateful, but they could not voice their praises as they were deprived of oxygen and could not talk nor breathe.
Thus, the Originator formed the Air Crystal to cleanse the atmosphere of impurities.
The humans sang their praises, but their praises were cut short as they shivered in the bitter cold.
Therefore, the Originator built the Fire Crystal to combat the frigid cold.
The humans tried to say their thanks but could not speak as their throats were coarse.
Finally, the Originator constructed the Water Crystal to satisfy our thirst.
These four crystals make up the Elemental Crystals. Without them, we wouldn't be standing in a world where we can place our feet on and live.

name: Kiernan
text: ... (For something that is so essential to maintaining the world--how come I never heard of these so-called crystals?)

name: Ulric
text: Like I said before, I will show you one of the crystals, the Light Crystal.

name: Kiernan
text: Hah! Can you, old man?

name: Ulric
text: Only if you come with me.

name: Kiernan
text: No way! Why would I go with some shady guy like you?

name: narrator
text: *whoosh*

name: Kiernan
text: Hey! What the-

name: Ulric
text: You give me no choice but to do this with force.

name: Kiernan
text: Let me go!

name: Ulric
text: Not until you hear me out.

name: Kiernan
text: Okay, fine! I’ll hear you out. Just let me down!

name: Ulric
text: Only a fool would believe you.

name: Kiernan
text: Argh! You...!
...a church?

name: Ulric
text: Yes, the church has been overseeing the Light Crystal for centuries. It is a closely guarded secret that only a select few know.

name: Kiernan
text: And how do you know this...?

name: Ulric
text: Because I am one of the select few who’s in the know.

name: Kiernan
text: That doesn’t answer my question.

name: Ulric
text: Anyway, I can show you the crystal as proof that the Origin Crystals do indeed exist. I’ll also let you down if you promise to behave.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Fine, I promise.

name: narrator
text: Ulric lets Kiernan down.
(Alright, time to dash!)

name: Kiernan
text: Hah! See ya-

name: Kiernan
text: Huh?

name: Ulric
text: I knew you were going to do that. You are far too predictable.

name: Kiernan
text: Argh! Okay, okay, fine I won't run away! Just let me down!

name: Ulric
text: Hmph. The little rascal you are. But, no matter.

name: Kiernan
text: (...On second thought, he'll probably catch me right away if I did...)
Ahem, well, shall we go now?

name: Ulric
text: Hmm, I did not expect you to behave so quickly. No matter. Come inside.

name: Kiernan
text: This is...

name: Ulric
text: The Originator, the god of this world, the one who created and shaped it.
(I can't place my finger on why, but...there's this burning sensation in my chest. It almost feels like...)
(...a deep hatred, almost loathing. But, why?)
(...Heh, no, I know why. It's because for one who supposedly loves all of humanity, did he ever do anything to help me out of my situation?)
Old man, if the Originator is this high and almighty being, then wouldn't he be able to prevent the end of the world?

name: Ulric
text: He would be able to. But, divine intervention bears a heavy price.

name: Kiernan
text: That's just basically saying that he can't fix this world without consequence.

name: Ulric
text: I advise you not to speak ill of the one who created all of us and cared for our growth.

name: Kiernan
text: ... (He's angry. Better not pursue this topic anymore.)

name: Ulric
text: Hmph, but he is benevolent and merciful for he has given us a chance. A chance to prevent the end of the world with our own hands.
The Originator does not guide mankind towards destruction but prosperity. Thus, the end of the world will be prevented.

name: Kiernan
text: ...okay. So, where is this so-called Light Crystal?

name: Ulric
text: This way.

name: Kiernan
text: Huh? Wait for me!
Hey...where are we? Why are we all in the way in the back?

name: Ulric
text: This is where the Light Crystal is held.

name: Kiernan
text: ...This is just a wall.

name: Ulric
text: The crystal is behind this wall. And I want you to open it.

name: Kiernan
text: What are you on about?

name: Ulric
text: Consider this as another test. To prove that you are the chosen one that will save this world.

name: Kiernan
text: That doesn't prove I'm a hero or anything. It's just opening a wall.

name: Ulric
text: Go on, open it.

name: Kiernan
text: (...He's ignoring me...)

name: narrator
text: Memory Game

name: Ulric
text: I knew you had it in you. You really are a chosen one.

name: Kiernan
text: Like I said, this doesn't prove anything!

name: Ulric
text: Shall we?

name: Kiernan
text: *cough* *cough* Ugh, why is it so dusty?!

name: Ulric
text: No one has been down here for years. Of course, the place would be covered in dust.
The crystal is up ahead. No time for dilly-dallying.

name: Kiernan
text: (This feeling... it's warm, kind. It almost feels like something ethereal.)

name: Kiernan
text: Is this the Light Crystal?

name: Ulric
text: It is.

name: Kiernan
text: It's... beautiful...

name: Ulric
text: Do you believe me now?

name: Kiernan
text: (...the crystal feels so... powerful. Like it has been here since time immemorial.)

name: Ulric
text: Don't get too close to the crystal now.
Every word you say, every creation you build, EVERYTHING that is that contains even a trace of your presence sickens me to the core.
I don't need a reason to hate your existence. After all, we're born to oppose one another, aren't we?
I can't help the way I was born like this. And neither can you.

name: Kiernan
text: (W-What was that?!)
(Ugh--there's so much hatred seeping out that my chest feels heavy--)

name: Ulric
text: Kiernan?

name: Kiernan
text: I--Did you feel that just now?

name: Ulric
text: I am not sure what you are talking about.

name: Kiernan
text: (So, only I could see those memories?)

name: Ulric
text: Perhaps you are shellshocked of getting in close contact with one of the Originator's crystals.

name: Kiernan
text: I...guess so... (I can't just ignore this, though.)

name: Ulric
text: Kiernan, you have to collect the rest of the crystals and save the world.

name: Kiernan
text: But, why me? Why not ask someone more trustworthy or powerful like the archmages at the Mages' Guild?

name: Ulric
text: I do not trust them. They will likely use the crystals for illicit purposes.
I trust you more than those archmages. You are more special than you realize.

name: Kiernan
text: You act like we've known each other for years, but we haven't met until now.

name: Ulric
text: I trust in my judgement.

name: Kiernan
text: (Being tasked to save the world. Maybe this is my chance--my chance to find out my reason for living.)
(For all I can remember, I wandered the streets, just wanting to survive.)
(But, it became more than a desire to survive, but to actually live--live a purposeful life.)
(Maybe through this, I can finally find that purpose. Maybe through this, I can live a life I was proud of.)
(However...even though my brain is telling me that this is the greatest opportunity I could ever receive...why does my heart tell me no...?)
(What do I do?)

name: Ulric
text: I'm sorry, I haven't heard your response yet. What do you say?

name: Kiernan
text: I...don't have a choice in the matter, do I?

name: Ulric
text: That is not true. You always had a choice.
But rejecting your duty to save the world and its people-Doesn't it leave a bad taste in your mouth?

name: Kiernan
text: (I didn't ask to be a hero or something. This duty was suddenly thrusted upon me. I'm not some noble saint who is insanely kind. No, I couldn't care less about the world. All I wanted to do was survive.
(But whenever I try to reject him, it feels like something is preventing me from voicing my objections...
I'll do it. But only if I'm rewarded.

name: Kiernan
text: Fine, I'll go along with this hero roleplay. But only if I'm rewarded for this.
(Though, considering how adamant he is about this chosen one stuff, rejecting him would have probably ended worse for me.)
A look of relief washes over Ulric's face.

name: Ulric
text: Thank you. This world will be saved after all.

name: Kiernan
text: But you never told me why the world is ending.

name: Ulric
text: I did, Kiernan. Were you not paying attention? The crystals eroded with time and with it, the world.
And restoring the crystals, the foundation for this world, also means restoring the world.

name: Kiernan
text: ... (That doesn't make sense. Wouldn't a god's creations be more...immune to time and erosion?)
(Maybe it was because they were creations by a god or maybe because I was literally holding the foundation of the world in my hands, but...)
(...something about them felt dangerous. Those hate-filled memories definitely proved my point.)
(But, most importantly of all, there's no doubt about it.)
(This old man is hiding something. Something that he desperately doesn't want me to know.)
(And the key to solving what that something is lies in those memories.)
(I have to collect those crystals. Not to save the world but to find out what that old man is hiding and to find my reason for living.)

name: Kiernan
text: It's been a couple of days since I've seen the Light Crystal. Ever since I laid my eyes upon it, I couldn't stop thinking about it.
The old man chose me for a reason. The whole thing reeks of suspicion, and those memories held the key.
First stop is the Earth Crystal. The old man said that he knew the exact location of only that one, though he says he's working on finding the rest.
Where is the Earth Crystal, you ask? Apparently, it's located in the Elf Forest. Like its name suggests, it's home to the elves, a mystical and long-living race.
Mana highly favors them, and people say that they were blessed by the Originator himself that they have such a high aptitude for magic.
Though, I suppose the true source of their capabilities partly came from the mana oozing out of the Earth Crystal.
Ugh, finally, I'm here.
The closest town to the Elf Forest, Mortus.

name: Kiernan
text: Time to start exploring.

name: Kiernan
text: This should be the plaza. It's eeriely quiet.
Let's go somewhere else.
text

name: Kiernan
text: The marketplace should have been the most bustling place in the town. And yet, not a single soul in sight.
Let's go somewhere else.
went to plaza first
went to market first
That's weird. Where is everybody?
This place shouldn't be so deserted.
Hello, dearie.

name: Kiernan
text: Hmm?
Would you like a snack?

name: Kiernan
text: Should I accept?

name: Kiernan
text: Oh... thanks...

name: Kiernan
text: (No, don't trust strangers.)

name: Resident?
text: Stay still...

name: narrator
text: Eyes turned to Kiernan.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Bring it.

name: narrator
text: Turn-based Battle

name: Kiernan
text: ...Hah...hah...damn, there's too many of them.
Need some help?

name: narrator
text: A figure was perched on top of one of the rooftops. Her ears were distinctively long and pointed.
Though, I have to say, you look like you're doing fine by yourself.

name: Kiernan
text: Should I ask for her help?

name: Kiernan
text: I'll like a helping hand, thanks!
Well, then.

name: narrator
text: A flash of colors breezed by, then the zombies were quickly wiped out.

name: Kiernan
text: (Wow, as expected from an elf. She completely obliterated them.)

name: Kiernan
text: I can do this on my own.
Hmph. If you say so.

name: Kiernan
text: *wheezes*
If a lady offers you her help, you must gladly accept.

name: Kiernan
text: Well, sorry for not follow proper etiquette, "miss"
I do not appreciate your attitude.
I suppose introductions are in order. I am Guinevere, a quad-elemental mage.

name: Kiernan
text: (What a way to brag. Humans usually can only control one or two elements. But a mage who can use four elements? Elves are something else.)

name: Guinevere
text: You're the first human who I've seen survived here. What's your name?

name: Kiernan
text: First human? You mean, there were others who came here too?

name: Guinevere
text: I asked you a question first.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Kiernan.

name: Guinevere
text: Thank you, Kiernan. Yes, humans from the Mages' Guild. I suppose they came here to investigate the strange disappearance in Mortus.

name: Kiernan
text: So, why are you then?

name: Guinevere
text: Why, isn't it obvious? I'm here to stop whatever is plaguing this town and creating these abdominations.
I'm afraid all of the residents have been converted into undead. However, something else is conjuring up more of them.
Unfortunately, even with my prowess, if I'm unable to find the source of the undead, it doesn't matter how many I purify. They'll keep coming back until we destroy the source.

name: Kiernan
text: What's strange to me is that they don't act like ordinary undead. One of them even spoke to me in a manner close to a living person.

name: Guinevere
text: Even with all my searching, I still couldn't find the source. I can sense you wield the dark element, Kiernan. The source should definitely be of the dark element.
You'll be able to sense it, wouldn't you?

name: Kiernan
text: Should I accept?

name: Kiernan
text: I'll help you.

name: Guinevere
text: Thank you.

name: narrator
text: add more dialogue later

name: narrator
text: The pair are standing in front of the town.

name: Guinevere
text: May you find everlasting peace in the afterlife.

name: Guinevere
text: Come on, be respectful.

name: Kiernan
text: Ugh, fine. May you find peace.

name: Guinevere
text: Would it kill you to be nice every once in a while?

name: Kiernan
text: ...Hmph. Anyway, you said that your family might have something to do with the outbreak.

name: Guinevere
text: ...Yes, it's my family's signature magic.

name: Kiernan
text: (I can tell that she doesn't want to talk about her family that much.)

name: Guinevere
text: I have to confront them about this. How could they experiment with the undead like this?

name: Kiernan
text: I'll go with you.

name: Guinevere
text: Huh? Oh, there's no need. I don't want to drag you into my family affairs.

name: Kiernan
text: No, I have to go.

name: Guinevere
text: *sigh* I'm not sure if I would be able to get out of this mess unscathed if it wasn't for you. I'll allow you to come with me despite my misgivings about your motives.

name: Kiernan
text: Thanks.

name: narrator
text: add more dialogue later

name: Guinevere
text: Well, this is the Earth Crystal.

name: Kiernan
text: (This one gives off a feeling of vitality. It's like I can run a hundred laps, and I wouldn't feel tired.)

name: Guinevere
text: The crystal doesn't appear to be corrupted. However, that doesn't clear the suspicion that my family has done something illicit with it.

name: narrator
text: *snatch*

name: Guinevere
text: What?!
Heh, I didn't expect the Earth Crystal would be such an easy catch.

name: narrator
text: A figure quickly disappeared into the wind.

name: Guinevere
text: Argh, there's no way--

name: narrator
text: Guinevere grabbed Kiernan by the arm.

name: Kiernan
text: Ow! What the--

name: Guinevere
text: After him!

name: narrator
text: Using her air magic, she brought the two of them to give chase after the thief.

name: Kiernan
text: (There's no time to waste here. I should go look for the Earth Crystal instead.)
I can't help you.

name: Guinevere
text: What--don't you see these undead roaming around? They used to be the residents of this town. Don't you want to bring them peace and help their souls move to the afterlife?

name: Kiernan
text: Sorry, I have something important I need to do.

name: Guinevere
text: Why you?! Aren't you ashamed of yourself?

name: Kiernan
text: I'm not a naturally good person. Best of luck to you.
(I wanted to find a place to rest, but if the town is infested with undead, then there's no way I could rest peacefully. Better off to the Elf Forest then.)

name: narrator
text: add more dialogue later

name: Kiernan
text: So, this is where the Earth Crystal is held.

name: Guinevere
text: Ugh, you insufferable--

name: Kiernan
text: Huh? Guinevere? You look terrible.

name: Guinevere
text: And I wonder why, leaving me to find the source myself and plunging head-first into a horde of undead.

name: Kiernan
text: But why are you here?

name: Guinevere
text: Like I should tell you.

name: narrator
text: She walked up to the crystal and examined it closely.

name: Guinevere
text: ...Seems untouched.

name: narrator
text: *snatch*

name: Guinevere
text: What?!
Heh, I didn't expect the Earth Crystal would be such an easy catch.

name: narrator
text: A figure quickly disappeared into the wind.

name: Guinevere
text: Argh, there's no way--

name: narrator
text: Guinevere quickly gave chase, using air magic.

name: Kiernan
text: Wait, what about me?! (No way, she didn't take me with her?! Maybe I should have helped her--)
(Damn, this is really going to drain my mana.)

name: narrator
text: Kiernan blended into the shadows to also give chase.

name: narrator
text: Chasing after the thief for nearly a couple of minutes, they stopped by a lake.

name: narrator
text: The thief quickly chugged something down before diving into the lake.

name: Guinevere
text: Argh--I lost him!

name: Kiernan
text: Can't you use water magic and give us the ability to breathe underwater?

name: Guinevere
text: An average water mage can't use that spell. It is a highly advanced spell that I haven't learned yet.

name: Kiernan
text: Ugh, so what do we do?

name: Guinevere
text: Don't lose heart yet. We can go back to the Elf Forest and find someone who can sell us an underwater breathing potion.

name: Kiernan
text: ...Right, I guess that is our only option.
